original.definition: excite to an abnormal condition, or chafe or inflame

sememes.reasoning: The verb describes causing a transition from a normal state to an 'abnormal condition' or state of 'chafe or inflame', which is a change in the physical or physiological condition of the patient.

participants.reasoning: The first 'Something' in the frame, which is the entity or factor that causes the irritation.
The second 'something' in the frame, which undergoes the change and becomes excited to an abnormal condition or inflamed.
The outcome of the action is an abnormal, chafed, or inflamed state of the patient, as implied by the definition.

Evidentiality.reasoning: The effects of irritation are generally directly observable or experienced.

Mood.reasoning: The verb's core meaning is declarative, stating an event.

Modality.reasoning: The frame 'Something irritate something' lacks an agent capable of will, indicating no modality.

Polarity.reasoning: The terms 'abnormal condition', 'chafe', and 'inflame' inherently carry a negative connotation, describing an undesirable state.

Volitionality.reasoning: The frame 'Something ----s something' indicates that the causal agent is non-volitional ('Something'), thus the action is non-volitional.

Confidence.reasoning: The verb implies a definite occurrence of causing irritation.

Iterativity.reasoning: The lexeme, as presented in a single frame, describes a single instance of causing irritation, even if the effect might linger or recur.

participants.reasoning: value_type 'abnormal_condition.n.01' is not a valid synset in NLTK.

candidates.description: the physical condition of having the presence of an abnormally high level of carbon dioxide in the circulating blood (gloss match)
an abnormal condition in which a normal opening or tube in the body (as the urethra) is closed or absent (gloss match)
any abnormal condition of the blood (gloss match)
an impairment of health or a condition of abnormal functioning (gloss match)
abnormal shift in location of the nasal septum; a common condition causing obstruction of the nasal passages and difficulty in breathing and recurrent nosebleeds (gloss match)
abnormal condition where the heart is located toward the right side of the chest (gloss match)
an abnormal condition of a fetus; usually discovered during pregnancy and characterized by an abnormal heart rhythm (gloss match)
abnormal condition in which an organ is turned inward or inside out (as when the upper part of the uterus is pulled into the cervical canal after childbirth) (gloss match)
an abnormal condition of the lungs marked by decreased respiratory function; associated with smoking or chronic bronchitis or old age (gloss match)
an abnormal condition of pregnancy characterized by hypertension and edema and protein in the urine (gloss match)
an abnormal condition resulting from taking vitamins excessively; can be serious for vitamins A or D or K (gloss match)
an abnormal condition in males in which the urethra opens on the under surface of the penis (gloss match)
abnormal condition in which an eye cannot close completely (gloss match)
condition in which both eyes are abnormally small but otherwise normal (gloss match)
any abnormal condition of the outer skin (epidermis) (gloss match)
a condition characterized by abnormal deposits of melanin (especially in the skin) (gloss match)
an abnormal condition resulting from compression of spinal nerve roots in the neck region; involves neck pains and muscular weakness and paresthesia (gloss match)

an abnormal condition in which cerebrospinal fluid collects in the ventricles of the brain; in infants it can cause abnormally rapid growth of the head and bulging fontanelles and a small face; in adults the symptoms are primarily neurological (gloss match)

an abnormality of development in which the upper part of an arm or leg is missing so the hands or feet are attached to the body like stumps; rare condition that results from taking thalidomide during pregnancy (gloss match)
an abnormal physical condition resulting from defective genes or developmental deficiencies (gloss match)
an abnormal condition in which an older child or adult retains infantile characteristics (gloss match)
abnormal condition in which vision for distant objects is better than for near objects (gloss match)

participants.corrected_reasoning: Candidate 'disease.n.01' perfectly matches the general concept of 'abnormal condition' as its gloss states 'a condition of abnormal functioning'.
